theme: जीव का परिमाण नित्य है अंत(मोक्ष) और अभी(अवस्थित) दोनों में कोई विशेषता नहीं आती

terms.अन्त्यावस्थितेः: अन्त्य (anta) means "end" and आवस्थित (avasthita) means "situated" or "existing". Together, अन्त्यावस्थित (antyavasthita) refers to that which exists at the end or final state.
terms.उभयनित्यत्वादविशेषः: उभयनित्यत्व (ubhayanityatva) means having both eternality or perpetuity. अविशेष (avishesha) means not having any distinction or particularity.

meaning: अन्त्यावस्थितेः च उभयनित्यत्वादविशेषः।Meaning: And that which exists at the end or final state, having both eternality and not having any distinction or particularity.Explanation: This verse from the Brahma Sutras is discussing the nature of Brahman, the ultimate reality. It states that Brahman exists in the final state, beyond all dualities, and is characterized by both eternal and formless nature. This emphasizes the infinite and transcendent nature of Brahman, which is beyond any limitations or characteristics.
